title: American Art Porcelain 18th-20th C.
description: This exhibit was inspired by “A History of American Art Porcelain,” which was published earlier that year and was written by Marvin D. Schwartz and Richard Wolfe. Over forty pieces were shown, all of which ranged from the 19th to 20th century. This exhibit aimed to shed light on “one of the most neglected fields of Americana.” The complexities of the porcelain making process and the inherent ties between porcelain and American history were heavily emphasized in this show. Items like tea sets, plates, pitchers, cups, vases, baskets, birds, animals, and busts were on view for visitors.
